chapter.para: Sophisticated system configurations require specific disk setups. You can perform all common partitioning tasks during the installation.
To get persistent device naming with block devices, use the block devices below /dev/disk/by-id or /dev/disk/by-uuid.

Logical Volume Management (LVM) is a disk partitioning scheme that is designed to be much more flexible than the physical partitioning used in standard setups. Its snapshot functionality enables easy creation of data backups. Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID) offers increased data integrity, performance, and fault tolerance. &productname; also supports multipath I/O (see for details). There is also the option to use iSCSI as a networked disk (read more about iSCSI in ).

warning.title: Disk space units
warning.para: Note that for partitioning purposes, disk space is measured in binary units, rather than in decimal units. For example, if you enter sizes of 1GB, 1GiB or 1G, they all signify 1 GiB (Gibibyte), as opposed to 1 GB (Gigabyte).
